title: Ping issues
body: Hi recently over the past week ive been having lag spikes from 60-200, its weird because speed tests show i should be 50 ping to the servers but im getting 200, all of my other things are fine just not league. My ISP is telstra and im on windows 8.1 any help please?

replies.body:
Fixed my issue

Windows+R

''cmd /k ipconfig /all''

''flushdns''

Enter game.

Profit

I'm having the same kind of issues with iiNet, went from 33-37 stable ping, even while watching a stream at high quality to 200-350 ping, mines been for about 2-5 days. I've been working a lot so I haven't been able to play much.  also on 8.1 windows.. if that makes any difference. 

Also, I disabled firewall it did nothing.
Do you have anything like automatic updates or scanning enabled or anything on your system? The default setting is to have Windows apply updates automatically without informing you.
I'm also experiencing this and it makes it so I can't play I also have Telstra and windows 8.1 My internet is fine but it seems to be just league

> [{quoted}](name=Mar3thyu,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=M1QlHFbE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-29T02:22:27.632+0000)
>
> I'm also experiencing this and it makes it so I can't play I also have Telstra and windows 8.1 My internet is fine but it seems to be just league

I think I fixed it try putting this in command prompt    ipconfig /flushdns
i tried that it didnt work for me :/
